[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 108]
Reasoning: **Analyzing the game strategy**

I need 22,000 chips, and I currently have 5,264 with four hands remaining. I can average around 4,184 chips per hand, which seems achievable! My current hand includes a pair of Kings, which is great, and I want to maximize opportunities. I’m considering how to play my pair and which cards to discard while keeping some for potential future plays. I’ll focus on playing my pair of Kings safely for now, keeping options open for later.
**Revising the hand strategy**

I’m already using my pair of Kings and have QD, JH, 4D, 3D, and 2D left. If I play the 2D as a filler, I’ll have JH, QD, 4D, and 3D remaining, which could help with potential diamond flush draws. I’m considering if it’s worth attempting a flush, but my hand doesn't have a joker. A full house would trigger bonus points since it still contains pairs, but I currently only have a pair of Kings. Should I consider discarding to aim for a better hand?
**Evaluating chip calculations**

I have four hands and four discards, so I should make the most of playing this pair. Looking back, my previous pair of nines scored around 182 chips with different multipliers. The kings could contribute significantly since they add 10 each, plus the bonus from the square and possibly a holo edition multiplier. Wait, my earlier score of 5,264 suggests I might need to refine my calculations, considering various multipliers and total chips, which could mean I need around 188 chips to get that score.
**Clarifying chip and multiplier calculations**

I figured out that my previous pair of nines should total 188 chips with various components: a base of 58 plus additional chips from blue and square bonuses. That gave me a multiplier of 28. I’m pondering whether the holographic edition on the square also adds to the multiplier, since the state lists a bonus for that. When calculating for my pair of kings, I added base chips, blue, and square bonuses to get around 5.1k. There may be slight variances, but it lines up!
**Planning the card play strategy**

To reach a total of about 10,360 chips, I need 11,640 in three hands, averaging around 3,880 chips each, which seems really doable! The best strategy now is to play cards [1, 3, 4, and 8] as a pair, estimating about 5,100 chips. I'll ensure I have exactly four cards to trigger the Square growth nicely. I'll include debuffed card 5 as filler and choose the 2D as another filler, while keeping the stronger JH, QD, 4D, and 3D. I might explore the possibility of a five-card diamond flush if I can draw more diamonds!

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.

Analyze the total game state and context above, and respond with the appropriate action to take next."}
